Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a low circular body and a ring-handle, now broken. The nozzle tip is rounded and fluked, and is flanked by raised ridges with voluted ends. On each side is a pierced dolphin-lug. The discus is decorated with a band of relief ovules, within which is a reclining Eros holding a torch, which extends along the nozzle-top, its flame near the wick-hole. The filling-hole is surrounded by a garland; there are three subsidiary filling-holes or air-holes. There is a well-defined base-ring. Covered with a black slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q555.bis)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine (trustees)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
